fields.label_info_title: Does the household have handwashing facilities?
fields.label_info_text: Respond "Yes" if the household has a handwashing facility or designated space to wash hands, water, and soap. Otherwise, respond "No".
fields.hint: Whether or not the household has appropriate handwashing facilities.

fields.label_info_title: Do you have any soap or detergent or ash in your house for washing hands?
fields.hint: Do you have any soap or detergent or ash in your house for washing hands?
fields.label_info_text: Respond "Yes". Observe. Check if you can see soap or detergent or ash in the handwashing facility, Otherwise "No"

fields.label_info_title: Does the household have access to clean drinking water?
fields.label_info_text: Respond "yes" if the household has access to improved water sources that are available when needed and free from contamination. Improved drinking water sources are those that have the potential to deliver safe water by nature of their design and construction, and include: piped water, boreholes or tubewells, protected dug wells, protected springs, rainwater, and packaged or delivered water.
fields.hint: Whether or not the household has access to a clean drinking water supply.

fields.label_info_title: What is the main source of drinking water used by members of your household?
fields.label_info_text: If unclear, probe to identify the place from which members of this household most often collect drinking water (collection point).
fields.hint: Main source of the drinking water
values: Open surface water (River, Dam, Lake, Pond, Stream, Canal

fields.hint: Where is that water source located?
fields.label_info_title: Where is that water source located?
Do household members use a hygienic latrine for the disposal of feces?
fields.label_info_text:
Respond "yes" if the household uses improved sanitation facilities which are not shared with other households. Improved sanitation facilities are those designed to hygienically separate excreta from human contact, and include: flush/pour flush to piped sewer system, septic tanks or pit latrines; ventilated improved pit latrines, composting toilets or pit latrines with slabs.

Respond "no" if they are practicing open defecation: disposal of human feces in fields, forests, bushes, open bodies of water, beaches and other open spaces or with solid waste.
fields.hint: Whether or not the household has a hygienic latrine for the safe disposal of feces.
Do You or Any Other Member Of This Household Do Anything To The Water To Make It Safer To Drink?
fields.label_info_title: Do You or Any Other Member Of This Household Do Anything To The Water To Make It Safer To Drink?
fields.label_info_text: Any action done to the water to make safe for drinking and use

fields.hint: What Kind of Toilet Facility Do Members Of Your Household Usually Use?
fields.label_info_title: What Kind of Toilet Facility Do Members Of Your Household Usually Use?
values: Pour Latrine flush to Septic Tank/Sewer
Pour Latrine flush To Open Drain
